website_summaries.verdict: Older kids may do fine taking these non-chewable probiotic tablets, which have good overall results on digestive health.
pros: Parents report good results with this tablet, often better than other chewable brands
Tablet is smaller than many other probiotic pills
Vitamins and probiotics are mainly vegetable-derived
cons: Not a chewable, which can be a problem for many kids
Dosage and nutrient levels are labeled in a misleading way, some parents feel

customer_reviews.title: Easy to swallow
customer_reviews.text: My twins were very picky about their gummy vitamins and we end up with a pile of orange ones no one wants to eat. They are 8 years old and had no problem swallowing them. I took photos so you could see compared to other pills and to a regular m&m. My daughter did say they smelled bad but it didnt bother her too much to take it.
customer_reviews.author: Abby Chandler

customer_reviews.title: Must Have SWALLOW-ABLE Children's Multi.
customer_reviews.text: I've got an insanely picky 3 year old and I consider vitamins my insurance policy as I continue to combat this dilemma. Pills work better for us as my child will make himself throw up nasty liquids. I had SO many issues finding a children's multivitamin that could be swallowed! Seriously, it's a challenge. However, my 3 year old has zero issues with these. Thank you for giving us this option! We highly recommend to other parents looking for a vitamin for their children that refuse liquid, gummies, chewable and flavored powders. For reference, we give this to our 3 year old.
customer_reviews.author: CharityLMG

customer_reviews.title: Great multivitamins worth the price
customer_reviews.text: Love these vitamins for my grandkids even though they're expensive. You do get what you pay for when it comes to supplements, as most of them have tons of fillers and cheap ingredients. this one is the best one I've ever found and the pills are nice and small so my kids can swallow them and they only have to take one a day. My grandkids health seems to be really great since we started taking these vitamins two bottles ago they haven't been sick their skin color looks normal their eyes look good and they've been in Good moods they're sleeping well they're eating well...
customer_reviews.author: Donna Presley

customer_reviews.title: kids one a day
customer_reviews.text: These are a good size for my teens to swallow. The "Teen" and adult vitamins that I have tried to buy are all too large and difficult to swallow. New Chapter tini tabs are another great vitamin that my teens can swallow~but my kids prefer one mega food to several mini tabs. (The direction says take 6 for adults so I usually gave my kids 3 or 4 ). I definitely prefer whole food vitamins and this is a great option.
customer_reviews.author: nobody really

customer_reviews.title: My child loves them!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this product for my daughter when she was 2. I chopped all of the pills in half and gave them to her periodically or when she asked for a vitamin. She has always chewed them and seems to enjoy taking them. She is almost 4 and still likes them and it's time to order them again. I like the product because it contains folate and not folic acid and is completely food based. I trust the quality of this company's products and will continue ordering their vitamins.
customer_reviews.author: Emmie

customer_reviews.title: Best for children
customer_reviews.text: I'm surprised with some of the negative reviews on here. My son who's 11 has been taking this for years now, without any issue. The pill size is not as big as some portrayed here. It's pretty normal. And when you swallow the pill, you're not supposed to taste it. This is, hands down, the best multi-vitamin for kids. I will continue to repurchase, for sure
customer_reviews.author: Wildcats

customer_reviews.title: They taste and smell gross but they give my son his vitamins
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my son who got braces a few months ago so he is not able to eat chewy gummies anymore. These vitamins have good ingredients but they taste and smell so gross. Being all natural what do you expect. My son complains every morning about taking them but he knows he has to. We have purchased them a few times now and will continue to do so until we can find something else or until he is out of braces.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Mattiello

customer_reviews.title: Small Enough to Swallow, but Chalky Tasting
customer_reviews.text: My son insisted that the was too old for chewable vitamins (age 11) and this was the only swallowable vitamin I could find. They are, indeed, small enough for him to swallow. However, they are not hard-coated and a bit chalky, so he couldn't get past the taste to swallow them on a daily basis. I returned and went back to gummies.
customer_reviews.author: Steph

customer_reviews.title: Natural and Organic.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this brand for my husband (for men over 40) and i bought the (womens daily) for myself. They are great. They are natural with organic ingredients and no fillers. So i wanted to get something for my kids that didn't contain a lot of garbage. We just got them on Sunday. The only issue is they are in a pill form and trying to get my 7 year old to swallow is a little challenging. However my 10 year was ok with. I am going to check to see if they have it in chewables.
customer_reviews.author: TD

customer_reviews.title: So good my kid likes to chew them
customer_reviews.text: Definitely one of the best kids multi-vitamins available. The aroma is quite fresh and I am confident in the ingredients which are all food based. My child likes the flavor and will actually chew them, which shows what good quality they are. I take them occasionally too for light vitamin supplements.
customer_reviews.author: honest abe

customer_reviews.title: Awful smell and not coated for easy swallowing
customer_reviews.text: My 11 year old son now only takes medicine or pills that are swallowable, so finding a kids' swallowable multi-vitamin was hard. I was hopeful when I found this one (the only one I could find for kids). My son started gagging and now is refusing to take them. Just be aware when it says "easy-to-swallow" - yes, maybe b/c of its relatively small size, but the fact that it smells awful and isn't coated made it difficult for my son to swallow. We are going with a chewable, which is not ideal but he'll at least take it.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: perfect for people with ALLERGIES
customer_reviews.text: My son has all kinds of allergies you can name - soy, wheat, gluten, milk, trees, corn, eggs, nuts, etc. and he is on a strict diet. This vitamin is free of many things that cause allergy. Also it does not have added sugar like most chewable or gummy bears. My son is not used to swallow it yet, but he drinks water to soften it then chew it down, and does not seem to complain anything bad taste.
customer_reviews.author: pdora

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: I love this vitamin but my 6 year old cant swallow it so he chewed it and it taste pretty bad BUT I would buy these again because of its quality!! Alot of these other vitamin gummies or "great tasting" kinds are filled with a laundry list of junk under "other ingredients"
customer_reviews.author: Alvaro

customer_reviews.title: Kids can't swallow
customer_reviews.text: Kids have a hard time swallowing them . They should make chewable
customer_reviews.author: Chris M

customer_reviews.title: Not for kids only swallow pills not chewable
customer_reviews.text: My kids can not swallow these and when they chew they are so bad that they won’t take them so me and my husband are taking them only
customer_reviews.author: JORDAN

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the picky palate child!
customer_reviews.text: My 11 yr old couldn’t find any other chewy vitamin that she liked the flavor of so I decided to try these. She loves them! Small and easy to swallow with no taste!

customer_reviews.text: Not sure about the flavor but my 4 years old swallow it with no problem. I like that it’s good base.

customer_reviews.text: My 12 yr old doesn’t like gummy /chewable vitamins. She takes these daily. Very good product. I’ve purchased 2x already.

customer_reviews.text: Finally a vitamin that can be swallowed instead of chewed for a child! Excellent product.

customer_reviews.title: Size matters
customer_reviews.text: I myself read many reviews prior to making this purchase. I was concerned about the size. I have a nine year old and she swallowed this with ease. It must be noted that we do swallow garlic cloves when sick 🤒 the pill is the size of the average liquid gel pain tablet. Not large at all in comparison to the size of most Megafood brand supplements. I love this brand and use them exclusively. When I went through chemo their blood builder was the only iron supplement I could tolerate and keep my numbers up. As to this tablets efficacy I can not say but I will update soon.
customer_reviews.author: Memerose

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: It's a little hard for children because of the smell but it is one of the best vitamins out there for them.

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!
customer_reviews.text: These vitamins are great for my son. We both saw a different within a week. The pills aren't very large. My son said, mom, I feel so alive. Lol his vitamin deficiency has since improved and now I'm a subscriber!

customer_reviews.title: Good and easy for the kids to take!

customer_reviews.text: We tried these because my son didn’t like the flavor of the gummy vitamins. We tried different brands at that, even the ones from Costco and Sam’s club. My son finally approved of these and said, ”it’s good.” Both children also, didn’t have any trouble swallowing these.

I like that they can supplement without sugar and added ingredeents that I cannot pronounce. They are not chewable so your little ones do have to learn to swallow the vitamin, but even my six year old can do it.

customer_reviews.text: Best kid vitamins around. Whole food and not too big. I take them too, someitmes, because of the price.

customer_reviews.text: What a truly stupid amount of unnecessary packaging for a bottle that is way too large for the 60 vitamin tablets it contains. The slogan “Fresh from Farm to Tablet” might lead you to believe that they are concerned about the environment, but apparently not.
customer_reviews.author: M. Trione

customer_reviews.title: Best vitamin, kid-approved
customer_reviews.text: Altho I hate that every kid vitamin is candy coated or flavored, we were willing to go that route if they would take them. We tried them ALL. Go figure that this non-chewable, non-flavored tablet ended up being the one they would go for....and we have no idea why; when it happens, better not to ask sometimes:). Maybe they know inherently that it's good for them. Great product. Good price. Delivered when it is supposed to be; were on autoship. Hard for me to find the 60 count elsewhere wo ordering, which is less dependable and more expensive than Amazon.

customer_reviews.text: The company needs to clarify whether or not this is safe for kids with peanut/tree nut allergies.

My daughter (8) has been a lot calmer (she can get a little hyperactive at times) since taking this and the MegaFood B Complex. Thank you MegaFood!

customer_reviews.title: The ingredients are good, but the quantity of actual vitamins in each ...
customer_reviews.text: This product came as a single bottle, about one quarter filled, in an entire shoe box size box filled with paper stuffing. I ordered 2 bottles (came in 2 separate boxes of equal size and packaging and fit the contents of both inside 1 bottle with over half of the bottle still empty. The ridiculous amount of packaging alone makes me not purchase again. The ingredients are good, but the quantity of actual vitamins in each serving is too little. 33% of the RDA of Vitamin C, for example. It's also not chewable. It doesn't claim to be, but I assumed being a children's vitamin that it would be, in some way, easy to administer to children.
customer_reviews.author: FLhomesteader

customer_reviews.title: A rare find

He has been swallowing pills since he was 5 because he cannot stand the taste of any children's over the counter products or prescriptions. Adult vitamins are way too large for him to swallow. These are perfect! They are just a little smaller than your average Tylenol caplet and go down easy. They would also be great for adults who have trouble swallowing large pills. I am impressed with the pills and the ingredients.

customer_reviews.text: I didn't read the fine print well, but when a bottle is labeled 'kids' I assume kids will be able to eat it. These are NOT chewables. I'm impressed with parents that could get their kids to swallow a vitamin and not end up chewing it. Bleh. Big disappointment. Won't be getting these.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Schoolland

customer_reviews.title: New Version Missing Key Ingredients
customer_reviews.text: I noticed the label has slightly changed so I compared to see if the ingredients stayed the same. Well good thing I checked, it's missing Calcium, Magnesium, and Potassium. I also noticed they're using cheapest form of vitamin B-12 on the market, Cyanocobalamin. If they're going cheap on vitamin B-12 then more than likely this entire vitamin is made up of cheap ingredients. The price of this vitamin has stayed the same, while the quality has gone down.
customer_reviews.author: Prince

customer_reviews.title: Love them!
customer_reviews.text: We have been buying these vitamins monthly for our twin sons for over two years now. As a cancer survivor it is important to me to know that there are vitamins like MegaFood that are made with real plant food based nutrients and not lab created chemicals. I highly recommend the quality and ingredients of these vitamins to anyone wanting a natural ingredient vitamin.
customer_reviews.author: JR

customer_reviews.title: Kids won’t take it - yet
customer_reviews.text: This may be a great daily vitamin but my kids won’t take it because “it tastes bad.” The kids are willing to take omega capsules that are slightly bigger, so it really must be about taste or texture. Note that my kids are picky and have sensory challenges. I don’t want to give a bad review just sharing our experience. I am planning to wait a few weeks and try again with something other than water. I’ll update if we have success.
customer_reviews.author: harleycart

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I've been searching for
customer_reviews.text: My daughter is REALLY picky with vitamins, so even when I bought her the kind you can swallow, she complained about the taste. These are just right. They actually remind me of a tiny version of my "Alive" multi-vitamins. A bit expensive for just 60 pills, but she takes them without a single complaint... totally worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Mommyneedsabreak

customer_reviews.title: Caused constipation/obstruction in child
customer_reviews.text: A few weeks after introducing these into my daughters diet she presented in the ER with a bowel obstruction. Sadly they’re not going to work for us.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic vitamins
customer_reviews.text: We ordered these because the neurologist suggested supplements with zinc and selenium after our daughter started losing hair due to her seizure medicine. The hair loss stopped shortly after she started taking them and has not returned. We are big fans now and may start using the grown up versions ourselves. Knowing these are from food sources rather than synthetic is really reassuring as well!
customer_reviews.author: Nimrod55

customer_reviews.title: Rip. Off. For kids.
customer_reviews.text: My kids hate swallowing anything and I’m terribly disappointed that they don’t make it fully clear these are not chewables for kids! Plus, the bottle is far, far too big - it’s stuffed with 60% cotton. I feel like this company is deceptive with the listing on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Mwhit3

customer_reviews.title: Great product, buy it without worries.
customer_reviews.text: Some people complain about the size of these pills. Those must be islotaded cases. My 9 year old kid has not had any problems swallowing them, neither have my friends’ kiddos. He has one every day. I will buy this product again.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Redz

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: My now 7 year old has been taking these for awhile now and loves them. They are small and easy for her to swallow, and haven't caused any stomach upset, etc. I like the real folate, and chose these vitamins in part because of that as opposed to folic acid.
customer_reviews.author: MamaH

customer_reviews.title: Great vitamins
customer_reviews.text: My daughter is 10 yrs old petite. She's so tiny that she still wears size 7-8 in clothing. This is her 2nd bottle and I've noticed the difference in her appetite. I feel that this is the perfect vitamins as we have tried different ones. Cons: its a little too big compare to the other vitamins but my daughter got used to it.
customer_reviews.author: Jem

customer_reviews.title: Like that there is no folic acid
customer_reviews.text: Like that there is no folic acid. Like that it is small enough for my 4-year-old to swallow. (She doesn't like gummy or chewable vitamins, so needed one she could swallow.)
customer_reviews.author: A&S

customer_reviews.title: petit wife loves them
customer_reviews.text: more expensive than other brands, but you get what you pay for...seems to be good quality and addresses all the dietary and allergy concerns she has
customer_reviews.author: smitty

customer_reviews.title: Best choice for kids vitamin no junk!
customer_reviews.text: Small enough for my 4 year old to swallow I had her swallow a small piece of food first since she practically inhales food things anyway. She then was able to swallow the pill on the first try! My 6 and 8 year old had no problem as they have been swallowing lactose pills for quite awhile. I love that these pill are not full of junk or sugar like normal kid ones. My kids love them too and talk about getting long hair! Win win!!
customer_reviews.author: s777mommy

customer_reviews.title: It’s ok but not chewable
customer_reviews.text: I like that all the B’s are in one vitamin but I need to give it to my son with applesauce
customer_reviews.author: LMarks

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: Great product easy on the stomach even my two-year-old toddler was able to eat three without being sick.
customer_reviews.author: Alecia Daniels

product_meta.title: MegaFood, Kids One Daily, Daily Multivitamin and Mineral Dietary Supplement with Vitamins, C, D and Folate, Non-GMO, Vegetarian, 60 Tablets (60 Servings) (FFP)
feature_bullets: FOR CHILDREN 5 YEARS AND UP: A comprehensive multi that's mom formulated and kid approved; Packed with whole food nourishment plus added nutrients for your child
NOURISHES THE WHOLE BODY: Provides 24 Nutrients to support your child's healthy growth and development; Includes our Fruit Phenolic Blend with naturally occurring phytonutrients
TAKE ANY TIME OF DAY: Take 1 mini-tablet any time of day, even on an empty stomach; Easy-to-swallow and made without sweeteners, flavorings or food colorings
OBSESSED WITH QUALITY: Made without GMOs, tested for 125+ herbicides and pesticides, Free of dairy and soy; Certified B Corp; Certified Glyphosate Residue Free; Certified Kosher
MADE WITH REAL FOOD, AND REAL PURPOSE: Premium supplements made with real food and added nutrients; We work with trusted farm partners who share our commitment to organic and regenerative agriculture
